greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) = highest power of prime(k) dividing n!, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) = number of occurrences of prime(k) as factor in numbers <= n (with repetitions);
T(n,k) = A115627(n,k) for n > 1 and k=1..A000720(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 01 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..125 of triangle, flattened
program: a085604_row n = a115627_row n ++ (take $ a062298 $ fromIntegral n) [0,0..]
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 07 2003
